content:
Checkout the newest blog on bytecodealliance.org! From the greatest hack of all time (asm.js) to running in billions of browsers, edge networks, and embedded systems, @Eric Gregory's article includes so many fascinating stories from the days of Wasm's infancy and what it took to make it happen.

https://bytecodealliance.org/articles/ten-years-of-webassembly-a-retrospective

Bytecode Alliance
Welcome to the Bytecode Alliance
10 Years of Wasm: A Retrospective
In April of 2015, Luke Wagner made the first commits to a new repository called WebAssembly/design, adding a high-level design document for a “binary format to serve as a web compilation target.”
And if you're on the cheeto site, help us make the front page: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=46799014
